subject: Economics
title: Dark Money in Politics: Wealth Buys Influence
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dark Money in Politics: Wealth Buys Influence.

hook.text: The Koch brothers spent $889 million on the 2016 US election cycle.

buildup.text: Citizens United (2010) allowed unlimited political spending by corporations and individuals.

discovery.text: Studies show US policy outcomes correlate strongly with the preferences of the wealthy and poorly with average.

twist.text: It's not just campaign donations. Think tanks, media ownership.

climax.text: Economic inequality and political inequality feed each other.

punchline.text: In theory, every citizen gets one vote. In practice.

quiz.question: What did the Citizens United ruling enable?
options: Unlimited political spending by corporations and individuals, dramatically increasing money in politics
